articles.title: 'This was not a riot. This was a massacre,' says Biden on 100th anniversary of Tulsa slaughter of black Americans - New York Post
articles.description: On the 100th anniversary of the Tulsa Massacre, President Joe Biden became the first commander-in-chief to commemorate the incident when he spoke from Oklahoma on Tuesday.
articles.content: President Biden on Tuesday became the first chief executive to commemorate the 1921 Tulsa race massacre that claimed the lives of dozens if not hundreds of black Americans 100 years, declaring, “This… [+4999 chars]

articles.title: Biden honours victims of Tulsa race massacre on 100th anniversary of killings - CBC.ca
articles.description: Joe Biden on Tuesday became the first sitting U.S. president to visit the site of the massacre of hundreds of Black Americans by a white mob in Tulsa, Okla., as he marks one of the worst chapters in the country's history of racial violence.

articles.title: Review - 2021 Kia K5 GT - OurWindsor.ca
articles.description: Despite the new name, the all-new 2021 K5, which brings North America in line with a global naming convention, occupies the same spot in the lineup as the Optima, with similar size and pricing.

articles.title: One hundred years after the Tulsa Race Massacre, its last survivors say their wounds remain unhealed - SBS News
articles.description: 31 May marks the centenary of a 1921 massacre targeting Tulsa's prosperous African-American community in the district of Greenwood, known as "Black Wall Street."
articles.content:
Lessie Benningfield Randle, 106, can still remember a house engulfed in flames and the bodies stacked on trucks, one hundred years later.
